item.title: FrontHugo
Giggity git: the fast git script
item.description: simplifying version control Link to heading git can be complicated. I made a little bash script to make life easier. it pulls, adds, commits, pushes. the nice thing is it asks you for your commit message. always pull before pushing. always wipe from front to back. avoid those merge conflicts like the plague. add an alias to this to your .zshrc or .bashrc. i called mine giggity.sh of course dont forget to chmod +x it.

item.title: Add Date For Hugo In Vim
item.description: Leader D Link to heading writing frontmatter sucks. vim to the resue. " Map <leader>d to insert the current date and time in "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS" format nnoremap <leader>d i<C-R>=strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')<CR><Esc> vim-hugo-helper Link to heading Plug ‘robertbasic/vim-hugo-helper’ its not great but its something HugoHelperTitleToSlug HugoHelperLink HugoHelperDateIsNow HugoHelperUndraft HugoHelperDraft

item.title: first blog post
item.description: 3 killer things I learned today coder theme for hugo smartclips for frontmatter keybind to create txt file on mac making a new file Link to heading ive set ctrl-n to make a new file this is the applescript i used: set file_name to "untitled" set file_ext to ".txt" set is_desktop to false -- get folder path and if we are in desktop (no folder opened) try tell application "Finder" set this_folder to (folder of the front Finder window) as alias end tell on error -- no open folder windows set this_folder to path to desktop folder as alias set is_desktop to true end try -- get the new file name (do not override an already existing file) tell application "System Events" set file_list to get the name of every disk item of this_folder end tell set new_file to file_name & file_ext set x to 1 repeat if new_file is in file_list then set new_file to file_name & " " & x & file_ext set x to x + 1 else exit repeat end if end repeat -- create and select the new file tell application "Finder" activate the frontmatter Link to heading using cliptools to write frontmatter for hugo blog posts is amazing.
